metadata.dc:author: Ortega, M D
metadata.dc:description: In Na+ grown yeast cells the vacuole is the main Na+ reservoir, maintaining higher Na+/K+ ratios than those in the cytoplasm. This asymmetric distribution may enhance Na+ tolerance. However, in growing cells the effect is of low significance.
metadata.dc:title: Distribuci√≥n del potasio y sodio en vacuola y citoplasma de Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
[Distribution of potassium and sodium in the vacuole and cytoplasm of Saccharomyces cerevisiae].
